citeinfo.title: Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) Data Distribution System

descript.abstract: Non-State Conservation lands are real property permanently protected from future development by fee simple ownership, conservation or other restrictive easements, or deed restrictions held or enforceable by recognized land protection organizations other than the State of Rhode Island. These include, but are not limited to, the Audubon Society of Rhode Island, The Nature Conservancy, RI municipal governments, The United States Fish & Wildlife Service, private land trusts and other conservation groups.
descript.purpose: General reference for planning purposes and small scale cartographic output
descript.supplinf: In addition to permanent legally conserved land, a number of properties documented in this dataset are included in a category called "Conservation Intent." This designation applies to areas such as local parks, recreation areas, or lands associated with cluster sub-division developments that are not strictly protected by a fee simple or easement interest held by a recognized conservation organization. Instead they are considered protected by the good-will of the owners (both municipal and private) to prevent or restrict future development beyond the existing use.

idinfo.useconst: This dataset is provided 'as is' The producer(s) of this dataset, contributors to this dataset, the Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) consortium, the State of Rhode Island, and the University of Rhode Island do not make any warranties of any kind for this dataset, and are not liable for any loss or damage however and whenever caused by any use of this dataset. Please acknowledge both RIGIS and the primary producer(s) of this dataset in any derived products. Versions of the RIGIS logo suitable for both printed and web-based products are available at http://www.rigis.org/logos. The following disclaimer must appear on all map produced with this dataset: These data were created by RIDEM for informational, planning and guidance use only. They are meant for use as a general reference, not a legally authoritative source for the location of natural or manmade features. Proper interpretation of these data may requre the assistance of appropriate professional services. Facility locations have not been verified by a RI Registered Professional Land Surveyor and are not intended to be used in place of a survey. RIDEM makes no warranty, express or implied, related to the accuracy, reliability, completeness, or currentness of this map.

cntorgp.cntorg: State of Rhode Island, Department of Environmental Management

idinfo.datacred: Terry Meyer, Peter Grace, Paul Jordan, Lisa Primiano, Carol Baker, Mary Hutchinson, Kevin Ruddock

attracc.attraccr: Attribute information was checked and verified by the various conservation organizations represented in the data. No formal testing was performed Please report any errors

dataqual.logic: No tests were performed to assess logical consistency
dataqual.complete: The data fully represent all conservation lands in the State of RI with the exception of lands conserved through the RI Dept of Environmental Management

horizpa.horizpar: No testing was done to assess the positional accuracy of the data and no representation is claimed regarding the accuracy or suitablity of the data for any pupose other than indicated elsewhere in this document and below Positional data were derived from either digital geospatial Assessors Parcel records or scanned/georeferenced hard-copy Assessors Parcel Maps. These sources reflect a broad continuum of source scale and accuracy. Their primary purpose is to provide a reference to a property's general dimensions and location relative to surrounding properties and public infrastructure.

procstep.procdesc: Property boundary delineations were derived from a variety of sources including: Municipal Tax Assessors data in GIS format Scanned and Georegistered Paper Tax Assessors Maps Digital and/or Scanned and Georegistered Survey Documents Hand drawn sketches Attributes were drawn from: Tax Assessors on-line sources Visits with local Planners & Tax Assessors and with the responsible land conservation organizations. All data was reviewed for accuracy by local sources.
Data contributed to RIGIS by the University of Rhode Island Environmental Data Center. Metadata reviewed, minor corrections made to formatting, RIGIS distribution information added.

cntorgp.cntorg: University of Rhode Island Environmental Data Center

mapproj.mapprojn: NAD 1983 StatePlane Rhode Island FIPS 3800 Feet

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: DEM ID is a crosslink to the RI Dept of Environmental Management File Number for properties where that agency holds an interest
GIS Calculated Acreage of Land Area
Identifies Calendar Year of Protection Status
Site Name refers to an area that may encompass several land parcels
Common Name refers to individual parcel

Conservation Management Organization identifies the entity responsible for conserving the property. Often the same as the Fee Owner, but may vary for properties under private ownership, but with a conservation easement
Protection Type defines the type of ownership interest protecting the property. In cases of multiple protection the highest interest is shown

edom.edomvd: Fee Simple Interest: Fee simple ownership represents absolute ownership of real property

Easement: An easement is the right of use over the real property of another. The right is often described as the right to use the land of another for a special purpose. Unlike a lease, an easement does not give the holder a right of "possession" of the property, only a right of use.

Conservation Intent, these are properties not strictly protected by law. However the owner (usually municipal or homeowners association) has indicated a strong intention to maintain as undeveloped openspace or lightly developed park and recreational land.

Deed Restriction: A restrictive covenant is a legal obligation imposed in a deed by the seller upon the buyer of real estate to do or not to do something. Such restrictions frequently "run with the land" and are enforceable on subsequent buyers of the property.
Recreation Easement (usually held by DEM or the National Park Service)
Conservation Easement
Agricultural Land Preservation
Other, unspecified

attr.attrdef: Purpose, why is the land protected

edom.edomvd: Developed Recreation (park, outdoor atheletic facilities, other)
Agicultural Land Protection (conservation of farm soil resource, scenic value, working farms)
Resource Management (consumptive use, wildlife & forestry management)
Habitat (wildlife refuge, rare species protection)
Public Water Supply Protection (maintenence of water quality)
Cluster Zoning (land associated with cluster or density bonus sub-division development)
Year round public access is permitted, although limitations on specific activities or usage may apply
No public access is permitted. Usually applies to properties in private ownership with conservation or development right easements

Limited public access. Most often applicable to Audubon, The Nature Conservancy, US Fish & Wildlife and local land trusts often have seasonal or other time periods in which public access may not be permitted

attr.attrdef: Data Source describes the type of information used to produce the approximate parcel lines of openspace properties

edom.edomvd: Town GIS Tax Assessors Parcel Data (local assessors parcel GIS dataset)
Paper Tax Assessors Parcel Map (scanned & georeferenced
Georegistered Survey CAD File
Survey CAD File (required spatial adjustment)
Paper Survey (scanned & georegistered)
Hand drawn sketch

attr.attrdef: Geographic Confidence is a qualitative term describing our comfort level with the geographic source material. Surveys and GIS Tax Assessors Parcel data tend to rate high, while a sketch would most likely get a low rating. This attribute was coded in an entirely subjective manner and was included a guide to future update efforts.

edom.edomvd: Low
Medium
High

attr.attrdef: Attribute Confidence. Like the Geographic Confidence value, this is a qualitative term describing our comfort with the descriptive data attributes included for each polygon. We found that there we often conflicts between the local assessors data and information provided by the fee or easement owner. While we'd like to believe that the Tax Assessors record should be the final arbiter in these situations, we've learned that non-taxable conservation lands rate fairly low on many assessors priority listing.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
